creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: man standing along L side holding wrists of a man lying on his back with a horse biting his ankle
inscription:
Stamp, Label

-- Andrus personal label on back of frame with this: Eugene Delacroix / Struggling Figures / Ex coll: Andre Sert

-- label on back of frame: E. Bourdier, L. Fortuner, Gendre & Succr / 67, Boulevard de Courcelles / Paris VIII Tél. Carnot 93-92 / Dorure / Cadres Anciens / Sculpture / Cadres, Sièges, Meubles / R.C. Seine 489.353

-- in graphite on verso of sheet: 24 | 6 cudie[?]
-- in graphite on back of backing sheet: [N 24] and measurements
markings: red stamp on recto, lower right: [E.D sale stamp], Lugt 838a; E. Bourdier label
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, laid down on thick laid paper
provenance: Delacroix's posthumous sale, Paris, 1864, lot 361; André Sert; [apparently E. Bourdier, Paris; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Hercules Feeding Diomedes to His Mares
